Name: Sònia Rescalvo Zafra
Description:
Sònia  and her friend Dori were attacked in the Parc de la Ciutadella by six skinhead neo-Nazis who repeatedly kicked them in the head while they were lying on the floor. Only Dori survived.

Sònia's killers were arrested in March 1992.

> The group was arrested by the Molinero team in March 1992. Neo-Nazi fanzines, American fists, baseball bats and Boixos Nois cards, the group of ultras followers of FC Barcelona, ​​were found in the registry of their homes. The judge sentenced them to a total of 333 years in prison.
> 
> "It was the first time that a topic of homophobia and transphobia was treated seriously," says Eugeni Rodríguez, of the Gay Liberation Front of Catalonia. For the lawyer who brought the popular accusation, María José Varela, supposed "an exciting moment" because "gays and transsexuals fought to get out of invisibility".

Sònia's death was a wake up call for the Spanish LGBT movement. In her memory the place where she was killed was renamed "Glorieta de la Transsexual Sònia", and a monument honouring the memory of LGBT people persecuted for their sexual orientation and gender identity erected.
